reference.title: Magneto Troubleshooting and Maintenance
reference.shortdesc: The magneto uses permanent magnets that rarely fail unless exposed to demagnetizing forces, though weak current issues may arise from debris accumulation under the contact spring.

section.title: Magnet Durability
section.p: The permanent magnets in the magneto are highly durable and rarely lose strength under normal conditions. However, certain conditions can cause demagnetization:

ul.li: Connection of a storage battery to the magneto terminal
Install a complete new set of magnets
Order replacement magnets from the nearest agent or branch house
New magnets come pre-arranged on a board matching their required flywheel positioning

section.title: Installation Requirements
section.p: Critical factors for proper magnet installation include:

ul.li: Careful assembly and alignment of magnets
Maintaining precisely 1/32 inch separation between magnet faces and coil spool surface
Proper securing with cap screws and bronze screws

section.title: Common Misdiagnosis
section.p: Weak current problems are often incorrectly attributed to magnet failure. A more common cause is debris accumulation under the contact spring. To address this:

ul.li: Locate the binding post on top of the crank case cover
Remove the three binding post screws
Remove the binding post and spring
Clean away any waste or foreign material
